intro: Clarkia amoena f. concolor, commonly known as the concolor clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, pink to red blossoms. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dark seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
